website_summaries.verdict: Surprisingly affordable for the super-speedy and widely broadcasted Wi-Fi signal this model produces, the AC1900 is an excellent option for large homes and businesses.
pros: Impressive 10,000 square feet of Wi-Fi coverage
Excellent for 4K streaming and online gaming
Features 3 dual band antennas for a greater range
cons: While this stylish model features high speeds, it lacks the “Easy Setup” button that some other Wi-Fi range extenders offer

customer_reviews.title: Not quite perfect and needs rebooting more than I like but still a good device
customer_reviews.text: When it works its good, but it freezes up from time to time and needs restarting. Software is easy to use but it too freezes up randomly and you cannot always get a firm confirmation that a change in settings is going to be saved. Sometimes it saves sometimes it takes several tries. As far as functioning as a bridge it does that and there are plenty of options. No one notices any slowdown from being on the bridge vs being on the main router either which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: MMM

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE 3/16/2020: The repeater has degraded to the point of being almost unusable. It constantly loses connection. No firmware upgrades, needs multiple reboots a day. Avoid, avoid, avoid. UPDATE: Has not been supported by TP LInk since 2017. They gave up on it. I began having connectivity issues after a few days. After updating the firmware, my password no longer worked. So I had to perform a factory reset. This unit is still losing the 5ghz network every few days. If I unplug it and plug it back in, it finds the network again and lasts another day or two. So be prepared to have to keep resetting it, as others have noted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazons Customers

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set-Up - Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought a D-Link AC-3900 Router, which was advertised to provide 6,000 sq.ft. coverage. My house is only one third that area and the router failed to provide an adequate signal to the bedrooms. That's why I purchased the TP-Link AC-1900. The set-up was as easy as pushing two buttons. I placed it half-way between the router and the bedrooms, where the Wi-Fi signal is now at its max. The other amazing thing is that all clients are all on the same network. Other extenders would create a secondary network which would preclude sharing of the primary network's resources.
customer_reviews.author: A. Westner

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value. Works through concrete walls
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to setup. Works very well. In Jamaica most houses are made of concrete and steel. This makes Wi-Fi unreliable at times. We have an Arris modem from FLOW our ISP. My wife gets a poor signal in the bedroom. I tried an RE200 plug in extender but it was unreliable. Did some research and found that this extender while not the very best was almost as good as the best solutions and at $47.95 was a lot cheaper. Wife is now very happy with the Wi-Fi in the bedroom, and that's a very good thing.
customer_reviews.author: Raefer W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Range Extender!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for myself and a client! I have a computer repair/web design company for 20 years. A+ certified! I work with all kinds of wireless devices. I am so impressed with this range extender! It has come down in price about $30 since I bought my first one. Amazon has the best price, worth ordering before you pay more at Best Buy. and it really boosts the wireless signal! You will have almost the same speed with the extender signal as you do with the router signal. Good directions! I found that it was well worth the money, happy clients! I have relied on TP-Link for years.
customer_reviews.author: Rocklyn Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Junk! I have tried two of these in separate environments and both worked well for the first day or two. Then almost like a time bomb, devices connected to the extended network would no longer connect to the internet. Restarting the extender would sometimes resolve the issue, but only for an hour or a day at the most. Sometimes restarting it did nothing. Seems like an issue a firmware update might resolve, but since TP-Link no longer releases updates for these, that’s won’t ever happen. Very frustrating experience with both devices we ordered. Both ended up in the garbage. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Cook

customer_reviews.title: Constantly drops signal
customer_reviews.text: Bought this highly reviewed extender to help when my internet kept dropping. Didn't provide any noticeable difference. Extender drops the signal just as often and I'm noticing buffering that wasn't there previously. Setup was awful. The written instructions were unhelpful because the product differed slightly so when I needed to push a certain button, it wasn't on the actual extender. Had to call support and that took a while as that person expected that missing button to be there. After several walk throughs we finally got connected to my internet, but it was not easy setup. Returning item.
customer_reviews.author: CeCe

customer_reviews.title: WiFi booster greatly helped our signal
customer_reviews.text: This booster is a match for the main TP-Link WiFi router we have. That router is in a shed behind us, so the signal strength was not great. When we added the booster/repeater, there was a marked improvement with the WiFi signal and now we are able to stream shows on our FireTV stick. We do have to shut off the repeater every once in a while to reset it when we loose either our 2.4 MHz Signal or our 5 MHz signal. Not sure why we loose the signal, but when we reboot, it comes back as normal. That is a little annoying, but the reset is easy to do!
customer_reviews.author: Jim G.

customer_reviews.title: Works OK as is. Is excellent with some minor changes.
customer_reviews.text: The repeater actually works well, but I had to change out one antenna on my base station and another on my repeater to make it work. The very directional Alfa APA-M25 works perfectly with this extender. I put one on the base station, pointing to the extender, and another one from the extender, pointing to my office. Now I have an excellent signal all the time. Since the repeater still has two other less-directional antennas, the coverage around the device didn't suffer at all from the swap. This was a lot more convenient than having to run ethernet cable across our house.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Setup can be tricky
customer_reviews.text: First, this extender is a real power house. I now have wi-fi from my back fence to front sidewalk, and yes, all over my 2 story house. Fantastic! The setup, however was a little tricky. Depending on your router, it can be set up to truly extend the current router signal using the same channel and password as the router, or it re-transmits your signal with another password. Read the directions carefully, but I can assure you the reward is worth the effort.
customer_reviews.author: C. Tallman

customer_reviews.title: Failed in 2 days
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine for 2 days. Setup is easy, and mirroring the existing WiFi is easy. But after only 2 days it failed to throughput internet. Multiple restarts and even moving it next to the main router did not solve the issue. It would work properly for a few minutes, then the internet wouldn't work through it. I've returned it and will be going with a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Marc M.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 2 months now it has to be constantly rebooted.
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for couple of months with only occasional reboot needed. Unit is installed well within the range, yet I am greeted by no WiFi LED’s on the extender every day I come home and every morning I wake up. It seems I have to reboot it 2-3 times a day now. Amazon tech support was no help and now I have two options, but something else or keep rebooting it any time I need WiFi...
customer_reviews.author: Sinisa Maricic

customer_reviews.title: Super easy setup!! Very impressive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a NETGEAR EX7000 which I returned as non-functional. I probably spent 3 hours messing around with the NETGEAR product before I got any meaningfull results and then for whatever reason it "hid" all the devices connected to it from the main router! Way to much trouble to get the thing to work !! The replacement TPLINK AC1900 extender arrived today. Following the TPLINK setup proceedure (3 STEPS!!!!) the it was online with no fuss no muss --- absolutely fabulous design. 100% recommended
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Works Well....when it is working
customer_reviews.text: Installation and set-up were a breeze. Was working properly and was giving good signals even when used at large distances. However, I noticed that it was disconnecting randomly at certain times. When this happens, I need to run the set-up again to get it to working properly. My application for this product is simply to browse the internet and watch videos so it doesn't bother me that much. However, I imagine that people who use the internet more than I do would find this very problematic.
customer_reviews.author: Mervin Emir J. Laforteza

customer_reviews.title: Horrible tech support; frustrating install; has to have unique ssid to possibly work
customer_reviews.text: Piece or crap. Needs firmware update to support apple products which is only available after hours of time spent with tech support. Its impossible to use as an access points because it continuously blocks access from devices and requires a complete reset. I spent weeks with tp link tech support telling me to do the same thing and not use it as an access point, and eventually they told me since I didnt buy directly from them they will not support it.
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes

customer_reviews.title: This gives great signal strength where we need it
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving this extender. I didn't have any trouble setting it up using the wps button. I had the extender on the desk right next to the router. It took two times to get the 2.4GHz and then one more to get the 5GHz. After that I moved the extender to where I needed it. Then I log on following directions for option one to change the extended SSID. I simply added -EXT to the end of both. I got this to replace a single band extender that wasn't working for our needs anymore. This gives great signal strength where we need it. It looks nice too.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat reliable not!
customer_reviews.text: Decent repeater but it randomly disconnects from the original network. Needs to be unplugged from power wait 30 seconds and plugged again to start working again. A nuisance but for the price it could be worse.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and works well but limited settings
customer_reviews.text: This repeater worked to extend coverage 70' from my house. It was easy to setup. The only complaint I have is that, unlike other repeaters, it hides the mac addresses of the connected clients from my main router so the main router only sees the TP-link macs. This disables the web filters that I have set up which limits how I can use this repeater.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick J. Ashby

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't act as a wifi booster
customer_reviews.text: First, it came with old firmware. I had to call tech support to get the latest version - they were helpful, but this should be automatic. Second, I wanted this to be a seamless wifi booster or extender. Instead, you have to connect to the device specifically - so as you move from room to room, you have to disconnect from this and re-connect to home wifi. It seems to only be meant for stationary items. I've emailed tech support for TP link and am waiting on a reply.
customer_reviews.author: user1000

customer_reviews.title: Replaced the Amped with the TP-Link AC1900 (very easy setup) and I now am getting a consistent 45 ...
customer_reviews.text: Just replaced our old DSL internet service of "up to 7 mbps" with Spectrum's cable "up to 60 mbps" service. Now from near the new combo modem/router I am getting that 60 mbps and sometimes more. Out in my shop, 150' away, using our old Amped extender I was only getting 6-10. Replaced the Amped with the TP-Link AC1900 (very easy setup) and I now am getting a consistent 45 mbps out there. So far, so very good.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Has made life a lot easier for me in keeping my devices connected. Transfer speeds are great, and the extra ports on the back are really nice since it saves me from having to put a wifi card in every PC I work on just so I can download updates from my workstation. I just leave one Ethernet lead out and plug it into whatever PC I'm working on with no hassle.
customer_reviews.author: DeathryderYT

customer_reviews.title: This is a very powerful and very fast router for video streaming.
customer_reviews.text: I had a much older router and it was too slow with video streaming. I bought this new unit and it is a big improvement in performance. I have very clear video streaming now and there is no delay. I can also go upstairs to my bedroom and there is plenty of wi-fi range to use my laptop anywhere in my house.
customer_reviews.author: E. D. Hance

customer_reviews.title: 5 minute setup, GREAT signal
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this morning at 9am. Delivered at 8pm. Thanks Amazon for that. Took a measly 5 minutes to get this set up with my current TP-Link wireless router (just received on Tuesday this week). Relocated 30 ft away. Walked the 80ft or so to the end of my yard, and max bars. Awesome. Been suffering with Google Fibers wireless router for 2 years and got completely embarrassed when 20+ friends came over and the game was lagging every minute or so on the stream. 100% solved with AC1900 extender and AC1900 smart wi-fi router. Couldn't be any happier unless I had bought these before being embarrassed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Worked great out of box
customer_reviews.text: This TP-link repeater worked with my Asus RT-AC68U router perfeclty straight out of the box. Used WPS and it setup perfectly with my ASUS router. Replaced an Asus RP-AC56 bridge/repeater which, oddly, did not work well with the Asus router. I am using WPA2-Personal / AES encryption with no problems. So far, I have used the same SSID on the router and repeater, in both 2.4 and 5.0 ghz spectrums with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: R. Garretson

customer_reviews.title: Failed after few months of use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this WIFi extender a year ago. Set up was easy and it worked well for the first 1-2 months. After that, it would not maintain consistent connection back to the main router. After a number of resets and restarts I contacted TPLink customer support. CS recommended to upgrade firmware, which did not solve the issue. TPLink was ready to issue a replacement under the home products 2-year warranty, until they saw that I purchased it from a reseller on Amazon. TPLink's warranty only covers products purchased from TPLink or an authorized reseller. I purchased this product brand new and was the original user of a faulty WiFi extender. I will never purchase another TPLink product. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: YE

customer_reviews.title: Finally Found a Wifi Extender that Works.
customer_reviews.text: For about six months I tried several other Wifi Extenders to fix the problem that I was facing. Needless to say, all other extenders did not work. Nevertheless, this Wifi Extender was super easy to configure and sit up. I would recommend anyone looking for a Wifi extender to purchase this one.
customer_reviews.author: Matt H

customer_reviews.title: Great for your shed!
customer_reviews.text: I have a network lab in my shed, and this is a great and simple way to add internet to my switches and servers out there. Setup was easy, and you can either duplicate and repeat your existing Wifi network settings, or turn it off the repeater function and use it as a wireless switch, almost the same as just running an Ethernet cable out there!
customer_reviews.author: Zachary T Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: This product is one of the easiest extenders I've ever set up! Product works great! We had one fall in a sink full of water and stopped working, we immediately came back to Amazon to order another one! I live on 3 acres, my parents have a house at the front of our property and this extender allows my parents to have wifi at their house with out purchasing their own wifi package. All our TVs are on the wifi and we all watch without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy Stutzman

customer_reviews.title: Tested speed in 5-ghz is 2-3x slower than my router
customer_reviews.text: I have a Netgear Nighthawk router and the plan was to use this extender for more coverage in the apartment but the speed is slow. I'm getting 200-400mbps through the router and with the extender 70mbps for 5ghz. I've realized I don't need this product.
customer_reviews.author: Warren

customer_reviews.title: Constantly had to reboot
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these. One has worked fine. The other needed to be rebooted every 24 hours or so. That was sent back in for a replacement. The replacement needed to be rebooted every 24 hours or so. The first one is still working fine and has never been rebooted. If you decide to buy, good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Arejay

customer_reviews.title: Problems with 5 GHz compatibility
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install but could not get the 5ghz band to connect to my current Spectrum router. Tech support nor seller responded. Returning unit as their online support site indicated I would need to replace my router with a TP-Link router to make this repeater work on 5Ghz. Bought a new mesh router / extender pair from Wavelink. This should be 3 times the speed and fewer problems to setup.
customer_reviews.author: JerryC

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I am getting 200Mb/sec from my router and about 180-190Mb/sec from the repeater. It does a good job extending my 2.4 and 5GHz signals throughout our house. Works well with wireless AC. Setup was very easy and has no problems staying connected to the router. I've tried cheaper repeaters, but none of the other ones transmitted at nearly has high quality speeds as this one.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Fink

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up - works great!
customer_reviews.text: We needed a repeater that would take our wireless signal out to my husbands shop. We placed it against the back wall upstairs in our house about 65 feet from the router. Great signal in the shop which is approx. 100 feet away. Reaches almost all the way to the middle with full signal and two out of three bars in the back corner. Shop is 60 feet wide. Easy to set up too! Just pressed the wps button on the router then the dp button on the repeater. Wala!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Falls

customer_reviews.title: If you want stronger and faster internet that is easy to setup and never fails
customer_reviews.text: Went from 1 bar in the basement to never wavering full connection and previously unknown speed capabilities....need I say more? If you want stronger and faster internet that is easy to setup and never fails, get this! Highly recommended, E-3
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: I have good internet but I ordered to see if I can ...
customer_reviews.text: I unpacked and connected to my router in 5minutes . I have good internet but I ordered to see if I can extend to my near horse barn to use wifi camera to watch foals to born during night. Iam waiting for my cameras to arrive but I took my Ipad there to tested and my ipad worked and signal was really strong and bfore the signal would cut soon I stepped out of my porch... Iam happy with the purchase .
customer_reviews.author: jeff christiansen

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Work as expected. I have an old house with plaster walls. Plaster walls mean that there is a lot of metal mesh in the walls that cause interference. I needed the extended to fee wireless to the back areas of the house and this does the job. It says it can cover 10,000 square feet, not sure it if does, but I do know that my phone switches to this device when pulling up in the driveway.
customer_reviews.author: TamcoFarms

customer_reviews.title: So so performance
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to install, however, after a couple weeks of using it, wifi signal simply disappears and connected devices (tv) is disconnected while the actual router is still on. No idea why. Then I have to restart the device and wait for the signal to come back on.
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.text: Received on time. good condition easy set up. Unfortunately I dropped the extender and broke one of the antennas. I will be purchasing stronger antennas due to my router location vs extender location. They are @ different ends of the house. House was built in the 60s. Brick exterior 2 story + plaster walls. Signal is better than previous extender !4 years old netgear one Now i get both 2.5 and 5 G use of the router.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Set it and forget it
customer_reviews.text: This works great as a range extender. I previously tried using a router in media mode but kept getting wireless stops on two models. With this TP link extender, I've had zero issues and great perfomance.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Only one place in the house it would work without ...
customer_reviews.text: Only one place in the house it would work without interfering c router. Far away from it but where I needed the signal. So it worked. I had given up on it but daughters boyfriend found the spot.
customer_reviews.author: A. Thometz

customer_reviews.title: Buy a brick and paint it black. It will work better.
customer_reviews.text: Wifi and the extender works better when I unplug it or turn it off. It has only worked the first day I set it up. After customer support and countless resets it will only work intermittently, often giving the appearance of no internet connection.
customer_reviews.author: SKI

customer_reviews.title: Not really as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help extend the wi-fi for my blink cameras/sync module on the other side of my house. I've had issues with it dropping all wi-fi connections. I've had to power cycle it 3-4 times in a 5 day span, and it has a strong connection to my primary wi-fi.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mills

customer_reviews.title: connection to the router was spotty
customer_reviews.text: I'm guessing it was not the fault of the extender, but the gateway is just too far away and could not get a good connection. I'm in the basement apartment, the gateway is on the 3rd floor at the other end of the house.
customer_reviews.author: John M Fasciano

customer_reviews.title: works great.  better value than netgear.
customer_reviews.text: worked as advertised. connects to my netgear blackhawk ac1900 router via wifi thru 2 walls and 25 feet from modem. plugging hard line into the range extender, the speed is about 250Mb/sec. provider speed 300Mb/sec. price is considerably lower than comparable netgear extender.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do Not buy
customer_reviews.text: the worst experience I have had in some with the equipment not working as advertise and the crappy tech support. Tried for 5 days to get the thing from randomly dropping internet while also having strong signal and all lights on. Finally got fed up and am sending the entire units back. I will never use TP LInk again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Getting awesome connection on phone in my vehicle down in parking ...
customer_reviews.text: Installed above suspended ceiling tiles on 6th floor of steel and concrete office building. Getting awesome connection on phone in my vehicle down in parking lot. We joke that we are providing WIFI to the entire city. USE A GOOD ENCRYPTION KEY! lolz...
customer_reviews.author: Benzpyrene

customer_reviews.title: easy installation but bad signal after few days usage
customer_reviews.text: I like it at the first couple days. The signal was great. However the worth had come. Keep getting bad signal and disconnected. No idea what's causing. I have no choice change back to my old one. Although speed is a bit slow but no disconnection issue, Returned this item. TP Link product is cheap but really need to work on getting good connection.
customer_reviews.author: Ben ming

customer_reviews.title: Using this as a WIFI bridge, because it was ...
customer_reviews.text: Using this as a WIFI bridge, because it was impossible to get Cat 5 cable to my upstairs family room. The system runs as fast as being directly connected, and eliminated a huge headache and remodeling cost from tearing out sheetrock to connect upstairs.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: For the digitally challenged or for a 'no problems' installation.
customer_reviews.text: When it comes to installing routers, switches, access points, etc, I usually end up doing it manually. This time the wall wart for the RE580D took longer to connect than the two presses of the WPS buttons. The 5Ghz and 2.4Ghz connections completed requiring no intervention. Highly recommended for those on blood pressure medication.
customer_reviews.author: EGB

customer_reviews.title: Terrible device.
customer_reviews.text: Hi guys, This is not a long term investment. It kicks the bucket after a year of use. Even while it worked it gave dropped connections every few days. You'd have to log in and reboot it. After a while you just get fed up.
customer_reviews.author: Retariatus

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work out well for me
customer_reviews.text: Speeds were very slow. I had better results using a much cheaper WAVLINK router and putting it in extender mode.
customer_reviews.author: Jon A

customer_reviews.title: Extends the signal throughout home & even improves the speed.
customer_reviews.text: I used it to get a better signal throughout my condo. Works great. Must confess my tech friends set it up for me, but according to them it was very user friendly. Before I connected extender on had 5 - 60 Mbps, after connecting I had + >600 Mbps. Even at my neighbor's condo on an upper floor in another building I get @ 160 Mbps
customer_reviews.author: Mandy LeBlanc

customer_reviews.title: Slower than Without
customer_reviews.text: I tested this thing every which way and wifi access was consistently slower WITH the device than WITHOUT. Also, the directions do not match the actual set up experience.
customer_reviews.author: ft

customer_reviews.title: A very good unit
customer_reviews.text: We have a tenants in a studio off the garage. i wanted them to be able to use our wi-fi but was very nervous about using a product that I didn't understand how it works. Well, it was not hard and it works once we moved the unit a few times. So happy that it was pretty easy. Even though it boasts a far range, I had to move it to the very back of the house to reach the rental. Maybe because we live in a brick house and the signal was blocked by it.
customer_reviews.author: wheresamber

customer_reviews.title: so I bought this bad boy and it's been worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could get wi-fi out in my detached garage where I have a small office. I tried a smaller, cheaper range extender first but it couldn't get the job done, so I bought this bad boy and it's been worth every penny. I can't recommend this product highly enough.
customer_reviews.author: T. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great strength at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Every couple months can lose signal but unplugging for a full 30 seconds resets the unit. Sends a signal through my thick brick walls.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Boosted signal
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit, that I was somewhat skeptical at first but my wifi signal is much better. Seems to be a well built product, I like the option vertical or horizontal positioning. I would recommend this receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Clydej

customer_reviews.title: Repeater works in 1890 brick 3 story home.
customer_reviews.text: Works fine and set up was very easy. I have had it about 30 days and have had to reboot it a couple of times, but it is a very powerful repeater. I also like how it uses the same router name as my Maine router.
customer_reviews.author: GretaRay

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent range extender with great tech support
customer_reviews.text: I had trouble setting up my 5Ghz because during setup, it will not tell you if you entered the wrong password, it just won't connect. I thought I had the same password for both 2.4 and 5Ghz. TP support figured it out for Mr. Dummy here! This is an excellent range extender with great tech support.
customer_reviews.author: A. Couch

customer_reviews.title: Works great, can receive a weak Wi-Fi signal and makes it a great signal with more range
customer_reviews.text: Loved it. We were living in a detached cottage behind the main house. There was only one corner of the cottage that had intermittent Wi-Fi signal. I installed this range extender in that corner. It had no problem receiving a reliable signal from the main router and we could now connect any Wi-Fi device with full signal throughout the entire cottage. Worked better than I expected!
customer_reviews.author: Charlie M.

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I'm so surprised how well this is working. I should have gotten one a long time ago. Our main modem/router is upstairs so we use this to connect devices to downstairs. It works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Clark McKinley

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Using as a media bridge for my home office. It's not repeating the wifi signal, just acting as a receiver for my legacy stuff that doesn't have wifi. Very easy to set up, rock solid operation.
customer_reviews.author: jmedarts

customer_reviews.title: Works ! Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Up and running in 5 minutes, plugged it in, logged into manager, put my settings in, then it reset to save! Strong signal for internet about 1/2 a block down inside another house. Using for security cameras and have 3 connected that were out of range before.
customer_reviews.author: Movielighter

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and sync
customer_reviews.text: Took less than 5 minutes to set up and expanded my WIFI range into an apartment inside a metal building. Nice thing is the range simply got extended without having to rename the router.
customer_reviews.author: Dad

customer_reviews.title: Now I have wifi in my guest house.
customer_reviews.text: I tried other extension wifi's, but this one delivers the goods! Now my guests have internet in my guest house!
customer_reviews.author: B. Green

customer_reviews.title: This wifi booster really helped with the signal in my ...
customer_reviews.text: This wifi booster really helped with the signal in my house. I now even get service in the driveway and back yard
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Was pretty good when it was working
customer_reviews.text: Was pretty good when it was working, had to be restarted at least once per week. I tried to update firmware but didnt work after the update. The 5 LED's are now flashing continuously without any functionality. Dont buy..
customer_reviews.author: Hans W

customer_reviews.title: 37 download speed with it vs 45. Does not augment Wi-Fi signal
customer_reviews.text: I bought the extended because my NVR required Ethernet port. It did not enhance the Wi-Fi signal like it should. Download was 37 with it vs 45. Don't buy it if you are looking for signal strength. It is easy to install. It arrived quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Nivvila

customer_reviews.title: Another vote for garbage
customer_reviews.text: Like others, I spent up thinking I would get a qaulity product. It worked reasonably well for six months and then I had to reboot it every few days. Well after 12 months, it became garbage crashing almost every day. I spent hours tryin fixes I found online including trying 2.4 in and 5 out, the reverse, changing SSID, playing around with channels and DCHP seeting. Nothing works and several firmware upgrades. I just don't know how TP Link can sell garbage like this.
customer_reviews.author: JMP

customer_reviews.title: EEEDeals...ac1900 WiFi extender.
customer_reviews.text: EEEDeals? My WiFi extender went out after 1.25 months. Purchased End of April..stopped Beginning of June. I contacted you, but I have yet to hear from you. TPlink was great to work with but would not give me a new one because you are a 3rd party vendor. Let me know if you would like to replace the AC1900 extender that lasted for 1.25 months. Thanks and take care.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: TP link AC1900
customer_reviews.text: Great range extender and repeater.. I have used TP link for long time and never had any issues
customer_reviews.author: Ulises Serna

customer_reviews.title: This TP-Link unit works very good I'm intending to purchase another one so that I ...
customer_reviews.text: This TP-Link unit works very good I'm intending to purchase another one so that I can have a more stronger Wi-Fi range through out my ranch home.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: This thing needs to be reset almost weekly, even daily sometimes. Super annoying! Dont buy.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Just don't! Outdated with no support! 7/12/19
customer_reviews.text: Had it setup in about 20 mins. It kept dropping signal and restarting every 5 mins or so very frustrating and not worth the time. Didn't know before I bought this that is outdated.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Williams

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant but figured I try it. Works great in my studio, 150 ft from the house, across the pool. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: C.E.Roman

customer_reviews.title: Match roster and extender from TP
customer_reviews.text: So easy to install, no technical support needed. Work great with your router that we installed weeks ago.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Mackert

customer_reviews.title: Better than advertised
customer_reviews.text: I needed full coverage at my home (my wife wanted a WiFi desktop in her craft room) . I was competing with 12 other WiFi signals. By adding this range extender I haven't lost signal and I now have WiFi all over my 90x30 city lot. Now I can use my Laptop by my pond while resting in my hammock.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: marginally better speed when it works compared to my Asus that ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing blows, marginally better speed when it works compared to my Asus that is 2 floors down. It also locks up every other day and needs rebooted. complete trash.
customer_reviews.author: K. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Unreliabe
customer_reviews.text: This unit is great when it is running but it locks up every 8 to 12 hours and has to be manually rebooted. No help on their website and after trying factory resets, doing setup again and again, and manually rebooting daily for over a month now it is going in the trash. Missed my opportunity to return it.
customer_reviews.author: GRM

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Works Well. had to set up unit twice before setting took. Not getting the speed I expected but its still high enough to stream Netflix into my back yard.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: the first one i bought worked great for some reason the second one didnt but because ...
customer_reviews.text: the first one i bought worked great for some reason the second one didnt but because of the first one this was a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Sanjay kumar

customer_reviews.title: great extender.
customer_reviews.text: Used it in montana for 2 distant garages and it works great. Have an extender in each garage
customer_reviews.author: sylvia

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. I bought one and the first couldn't establish a connection. After 30 mins with support the guy said it was bad. 2nd one couldn't hold the connection for more than a day and it would require a reset. Complete garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolette

customer_reviews.title: Serious boost
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I’ve used that works to receive WiFi in a workshop just outside my home. Setup had a couple hiccups but nothing reading the instructions couldn’t fix. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ACC120

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Once I received the extender, I set it up in about two minutes.It works fine but some of my devices won't connect to the Wi-Fi extender. Could be my devices. I still recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: quietstorm

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use but tech support is awful
customer_reviews.text: After a year of working fine it finally started giving me issues of not connecting to the internet. Don't be fooled by the 2 year warranty. Had to talk to several people as they all had options to troubleshoot a million things (which didn't fix) and still won't send a replacement. I won't be buying this brand again
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Losey

customer_reviews.title: Less enthusiastic over time
customer_reviews.text: The longer I have this unit the less I like - seems to drop wifi connection often and when paired with a TP-Link RE580D "repeater" it becomes a regular process of rebooting both devices.
customer_reviews.author: Clay Boswell

customer_reviews.title: Love this wifi extender.
customer_reviews.text: This unit is easy to get up and running with your current wifi setup. Takes less than 5 minutes to get fast 5G wifi all around your house. The best part is the 5 gigabit ethernet ports on the back they give my PC and game consoles fast and stable connections to my internet.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: It just works!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to replace a defective unit from a different manufacturer - and it's been working without any issues. It never looses a connection, survives router reboots and does not hang under heavy load. There's only one thing I do not like about it: it cannot check/install the latest updates automatically - you have to go to their website, download an update, if any, and install it.
customer_reviews.author: Aliaksei Baturytski

customer_reviews.title: Awful!
customer_reviews.text: After buying and installing this my internet is slower or lacks all connectivity. I have moved the extended to several different locations and the problem persists. Unusable!
customer_reviews.author: gmcs

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last a year.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 11 months. Then, I started to lose connections and it would turn off on its own. Paid a hundred for this. Sad it couldn’t make it over a year.
customer_reviews.author: DeLintFan

customer_reviews.title: Never Got It Working
customer_reviews.text: I have not been able to install this and get connected to the internet through it. I followed the install and everything seems fine but after 5 minutes no internet. I bought a Netgear Orbi system and it installed and works flawlessly. TP Link tech support was weak.
customer_reviews.author: Dad2Ten

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: Disconnects A LOT, but when it is working, it is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Peacock

customer_reviews.title: Have to reset everyday.  Perfect otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly for two weeks. Have to restart it every morning now. It's been 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick A McCarty

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money product is not a good one
customer_reviews.text: Don’t work that good and only work for a short time when it did work
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Great Extender!
customer_reviews.text: Used this extender for a install at a church. Hooked up router no issues, great app program to go along with this extender.
customer_reviews.author: John Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Not able to connect with browser, following the instructions ...
customer_reviews.text: Not able to connect with browser, following the instructions and many attempts. Connect with WPS works, but still can't connect via browser.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, Setup Could be Easier
customer_reviews.text: Works great at extending my wireless, setup could be easier....
customer_reviews.author: DHA

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: i love this range extender keeps my internet speeds fast very easy to install i would recommend this product to anybody who needs something like this
customer_reviews.author: jake

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Worked for less than one day. Lost all connectivity. Contacted their customer service. In the middle of the live-chat, the agent said, "Follow the guide" and logged off. We had been following the guide when we ran into a problem that required Customer Service. Finally got the extender to work after @ 4 hours of effort only to have it randomly drop signal and require a reset. Would not recommend this product at all, nor would I bother contacting their customer service department again. Disconnected, in a box, in the trash. A $110 lesson in how not to improve your home wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: TP-Link AC1900 Desktop Dual Band Wi-Fi Range Extender w/ 5 Gigabit Ethernet Ports (RE580D),Black/Grey
product_meta.description: Experience high performance Wi Fi throughout your home with the RE580D AC1900 Dual Band Wi Fi Range Extender. Enjoy faster streaming at speeds up to 1900Mbps. Connect your smart TVs, game consoles, and streaming players to Wi Fi using one of the five dedicated Gigabit Ethernet Ports. Discover the best location and set up anywhere in your home using the Smart Signal Indicator. Set up and manage your Wi Fi settings with the TP LINK Tether App from your Android or iOS smartphone or tablet. Increase device Wi Fi performance with beamforming technology that finds and boosts Wi Fi to every device. Frequency Range: 2.4GHz & 5GHz(11ac); Interface Available: 5 x 10/100/1000Mbps Ethernet Port (RJ45); System Requirement: Microsoft Windows 98SE NT 2000 XP Vista or Windows 7 8 10 Mac OS NetWare UNIX or Linux; Wireless Standards: IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n/ac
feature_bullets: Simultaneous gaming and 4K HD streaming with dual band speeds up to 1900Mbps ; Works with any WiFi router or wireless access point
Provides fast, reliable connections to multiple users with 1GigaHertz dual core processor
Connects smart TVs and game consoles directly to WiFi using Gigabit Ethernet ports
Find the best spot to set up with the Smart Signal Indicator
Three external dual band antennas with 700mW high powered amplifiers help boost WiFi range
Industry leading 2 year warranty and unlimited 24/7 technical support

specifications.Operating System: Microsoft Windows 98SE, NT, 2000, XP, Vista or Windows 7, 8, 10, Mac OS, NetWare, UNIX or Linux
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars556 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
